content.description: Nice natural line that follows the crack system, trending left up the wall. Pass a bush in the crack and find a splitter that runs diagonal. Leads you up to a couple of beautiful nut placements in a corner up to the anchors.
content.protection: Single rack to #3. Optional doubles of small gear.
content.location: Looking at Cat's Cradle wall, Silver Spoon starts up the furthest right crack system. Just to the left of The Moderate.

content.description: Climb easy trough to saddle and work up left. Traversing unto the main face for a bit and following the weakness to the right of the summit block. Here you ease into the west facing aspect of the summit block, clipping a bolt and finishing on friction to the very top.This is one of the few fun and easy moderates at Council Rocks, enjoy!
content.location: The farthest right route at the cliff. Look for the low angle wide trough leading up to the saddle 15 feet above.

climbs.name: Little Cat Crack
climbs.fa: Will McConaughy, Christa McConaughy, Peter Powers

content.description: This is the central, main crack system on the right side of the wall. The climb starts in a tricky corner, up through a meandering crack, and continues to the apex of the green lichen covered summit cone. One low bolt protects the crux sequence and marks the start of this fantastic climb. Continue past the bolt aiming straight up to the crack above, offset micros may put your mind at ease pulling these moves. Once past the crux, joyous crack climbing awaits you for the remainder of this lovely route. Underneath the summit block make sure to trend left to stay on route, and work your way right past chickenheads to the central rap station.
content.protection:
1 Bolt   Nuts   1 X #0.3 - #3   Small offset micros are helpful if you got em 

  Rap Anchors at top
content.location: Find the lone bolt above a shallow dihedral, 20 ft right of the large roof system in the center of the wall

content.description: This route is so much fun! But heads up, the crux is protected by a somewhat sketchy nut placement. Crux is about half way up before you head in to the corner. But overall, the whole route has engaging moves, nice flow, and enough challenge to keep you on your toes!
content.protection: Single rack to #1, doubles of small gear, lots of nuts, offsets could help!
content.location: Check photo for drawn topo. Route could be started from a boulder to the right or for a few more moves of awesome start on the ground using some of the great holds!

content.description: This north facing crag lies in a protected cove on the backside of the Fist Pinnacle hillside. The sheltered position of this wall amongst a grove of trees and surrounded by rocks provides good shade and protection from the wind on a blustery day. Many crack systems delineate this cozy wall; try some of the few moderates in the Fist Pinnacle area or continue the 5.10 send train on the harder gems at the wall!
